name: raceme
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a group of flowers on a plant that are attached to a central stem by short stalks (= thin stems) of equal length: It is a low-growing plant with racemes of white, sweet-scented flowers. The wisteria is known for the beauty of its flowers, which appear in long, cascading racemes.
More examplesFewer examplesThe tree lupin is a woody evergreen shrub with compound palmate leaves and short racemes of pale yellow, delicately perfumed flowers.Its racemes of lavender flowers are not unlike wisteria in their overall effect.The raceme, which appears about the sixth to the tenth month, will take sixty days more to ripen.
